result.execSummary:
The defendant Efren Gutierrez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No contact with L. Somers, J. Drover and/or S. Jenks directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
Uncharged Delivery of Heroin stemming from an incident that took place prior to December 23, 2015 dismissed and read in.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit. The Court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.
Same conditions as noted in Count 1 with the exception of the jail time.

Case called @ 2:12 p.m. Defendant Efren Gutierrez in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have received the PSI. No corrections or clarifications to be noted. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 3 years probation as to both counts concurrent - Conditions: As to Ct 1 only - 8 mos WC Jail - Huber, No GT, 1 day CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than November 11, 2016, As to both counts -  defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, DE is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, AODA and follow through, Maintain gainful full-time employment, NC w/ L. Somers, J. Drover, and/or S. Jenks, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, $240 drug buy money, DNA sample and surcharge. The Court has not objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction. Appeal rights given.
from DOC advising that the PSI may not be received by the Court until 9/6/16
Sentencing hearing on September 12, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Case called @ 2:20 p.m. Defendant Efren  Gutierrez in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 3 - DRI. Uncharged Delivery of Heroin stemming from an incident that took place prior to December 23, 2015 - DRI.  The defendant requests a PSI which the Court orders.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

15TR374 & 15TR375 - Atty Zouski present due to defendant's unpaid financial obligations. The Court orders that the defendant must pay $50 monthly starting 2/1/2016 until paid in full.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
